definitions: (of an operation) be canceled automatically because a predefined interval of time has passed without a certain event happening.
(of a computer or a program) cancel an operation automatically because a predefined interval of time has passed without a certain event happening

examples.text: connections are timed out when they're not in use

shortDefinitions: (of computer or program) cancel operation automatically

definitions: time for rest or recreation away from one's usual work or studies

examples.text: she is taking time out from her hectic tour

shortDefinitions: time for rest or recreation away from one's usual work or studies

definitions: a brief break in play in a game or sport

examples.text: he inadvertently called for a timeout with two seconds remaining

shortDefinitions: brief break in play in game or sport

definitions: an imposed temporary suspension of activities, especially the separation of a misbehaving child from one or more playmates as a disciplinary measure

examples.text: it's the third time this week he's been in time-out

shortDefinitions: brief period of time during which misbehaving child is put on their own so that they can regain control over their emotions

definitions: a cancellation or cessation that automatically occurs when a predefined interval of time has passed without a certain event occurring.
shortDefinitions: cancellation or cessation that automatically occurs when predefined interval of time has passed without certain event occurring
